challenge.description: Capacity fading due to structural instability induced by Jahn-Teller distortion and manganese dissolution via Mn3+ disproportionation reaction.
challenge.impact: Reduces the long-term electrochemical performance and stability of the cathode material in lithium-ion batteries.

solution.description: Increased lithium content in the spinel structure to suppress Mn dissolution and improve stability.
solution.methodology: Gradual adjustment of lithium content (x = 1.0, 1.02, 1.04, 1.06) in the synthesis process.
solution.effectiveness: Effective in reducing Mn dissolution and enhancing rate capability, as evidenced by improved electrochemical performance.

evidence.data: Rate capability and resistance values (Rsf and Rct) improved with increased lithium content, indicating reduced Mn dissolution and better stability.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with Mn ions in octahedral sites and Li ions in tetrahedral sites.
context.experimental_conditions: Solid-state synthesis method with varying Li/Mn ratios and electrochemical testing at different C-rates.
context.application_relevance: Enhances the performance and stability of LiMn2O4 as a cathode material for high-power lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Existence of a second phase with different lattice parameters, leading to spot splitting on the (400) plane.
challenge.impact: Complicates the crystallographic analysis and affects the prediction of battery performance.

solution.description: Refinement of the structure using XRD and TEM to identify the dominant phase and secondary phases.
solution.methodology: Rietveld refinement and TEM imaging to characterize the second phase and its transformation with varying lithium content.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully identified the second phase and its gradual transformation, enabling better understanding of its impact on electrochemical performance.

evidence.source: Results and Discussion sections, Figures 1, 11, and Table 1.
evidence.data: Spot splitting observed in TEM images and changes in lattice constants with increasing lithium content.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with secondary phases dominated by Mn4+ ions.
context.experimental_conditions: Characterization performed using XRD, TEM, and XPS under controlled synthesis conditions.
context.application_relevance: Understanding the second phase helps optimize the material for better electrochemical performance in lithium-ion batteries.
